result.execSummary:
The defendant Hezekiah J Chessir was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with credit for 4 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

**Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs, successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.**

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Hezekiah J Chessir

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs successfully, completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

The Court ordered defendant to serve 4 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

Court ordered defendant to pay $100.00 fine and all applicable court costs by 11/18/2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Court ordered a DNA sample.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  

Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.

Defendant Hezekiah J Chessir in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Hezekiah J Chessir in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Case calendared for projected guilty plea. For reasons stated on the record,   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Hezekiah J Chessir in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: KAR. Case calendared for a status conference.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 37.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Hezekiah J Chessir in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Alex Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Defense requested a  status conference. Case adjourned to Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Robert C.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Hezekiah J Chessir in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 8-7-2015 at 1:30pm
